title: Trump gets $15m in ABC News defamation case
byline: ABC News has agreed to pay $15m (£12m) to US President-elect Donald Trump to settle a defamation lawsuit after its star anchor falsely said he had been found ’’liable for rape’’.

title: 32-year-old killed in shooting at Meegoda
byline: A 32-year-old man was killed in a shooting incident at Nagahawatta, Meegoda, last night.

title: President receives grand welcome in India
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake arrived in India today (15) at around 5:30 p.m via the Indira Gandhi International Airport in New Delhi, the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: PUCSL to begin public consultations on electricity tariff revision from Tuesday
byline: The Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) announced today that public consultations on the electricity tariff revision will commence on Tuesday,  Tuesday (17).

title: Anyone elected to Parliament can become Speaker; doctorate, educational certificate not needed: Chamal
byline: Claiming that a doctorate or an educational certificate was not needed to become the Speaker, former Speaker Chamal Rajapaksa said anyone who is elected to Parliament without a doctorate or even an educational certificate can become a Speaker.

title: Nagapattinam-KKS passenger ferry services to resume in January after suspension
byline: The passenger ferry services between Nagapattinam in India and Kankesanthurai (KKS), Jaffna in Sri Lanka’s Northern Province is scheduled to resume next January.

title: Met Department warns of weather pattern changes within next 24 hours
byline: Due to formation of a low-pressure area over the southeast Bay of Bengal, the Meteorological Department has issued a weather warning for the land and also the sea areas surrounding the island, valid for the next 24 hours.

title: Rajarata Rajina and Sagarika collide in Beliatta
byline: The engines of the Sagarika express train and the Rajarata Rajina express train collided at the Beliatta Railway Station this morning, the Railways Department reported.

title: Five Acting Ministers appointed
byline: Five acting Ministers have been appointed to oversee key Ministries during President Anura Kumara Dissanayake’s visit to India, the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: President leaves for India
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake left the island this afternoon for India, marking his first official foreign visit since assuming office, President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: Opposition to nominate member for Speaker’s post
byline: The Opposition will nominate an MP for the Speaker’s post on Tuesday when Parliament meets to elect a successor to Ashoka Ranwala who resigned from his post last week.

title: Is the government at risk of over-borrowing in 2024?
byline: In the wake of Sri Lanka’s recent presidential election, there has been growing debate over the government’s borrowing strategy for 2024. While some critics warn of excessive borrowing, others argue that it is necessary for fiscal stability.

title: Pope appoints Gnanapragasam Anthonypillai as new Bishop of Mannar
byline: Pope Francis has officially appointed Reverend Gnanapragasam Anthonypillai as the new Bishop of Mannar, following the resignation of Bishop Fidelis Lionel Emmanuel Fernando from the pastoral care of the diocese.
